subject: RE: [junit] Question.
msgSnippet: need a factory  Do you find that factories which exist to switch between test and non-test code make the design of the system more complex? Michael Finney
messageBody:
"need a factory" Do you find that factories which exist to switch between
test and non-test code make the design of the system more complex?

Michael Finney
Sun Certified Programmer for the Java 2 Platform
Sun Certified Developer for the Java 2 Platform


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Johannes Link [SMTP:john.link@...]
> Sent: Monday, March 05, 2001 12:14 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Question.
>
> > Just a question, scenario:
> >
> > Let say, i have class A and class B.
> >
> > I would like to write a test case for class A which later will then link
> > to class B but the class B's method hasn't completed but i know the
> > class B will return a value, is that possible for me to test the Class A
> > to link with Class B ? As i just want to make sure the linking is okie
> > and my ideas of class B are working fine.....;-)
> >
> > I hope i won't confuse you guys ! ;-)
>
> Extract class B's public methods as an interface and provide a dummy
> implementation for that; this should be easy since you know what value to
> return. Now you can test class A independently of the real implementation.
> Additionally you might need a factory which returns either an instance of
> BDummy or BReal.
>
> Johannes
>
>
